faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: Do I lose operational control of my business with a local sponsor?
items.answer: No! While local sponsors hold 51% of your company, you retain full operational, financial, and decision-making control.

items.question: What is the difference between an individual and a corporate sponsor?
items.answer: An individual sponsor is a UAE national, while a corporate sponsor is a UAE-owned company. A corporate sponsor generally offers more stability, continuity, and reduced long-term risk.

items.question: How long does the company setup process take with a local sponsor?
items.answer: Most mainland setups are completed within a few days to a couple of weeks, depending on your business activity and required approvals.

items.question: Can I start my business without a local sponsor in Dubai?
items.answer: Yes, you can register and operate your Dubai-based business in designated Free Zones. However, most Mainland companies require a UAE national sponsor or agent.

items.question: What type of businesses require a local sponsor?
items.answer: Most mainland LLCs in the trading, construction, retail, manufacturing, and commercial sectors require sponsorship, whereas professional services may use an LSA instead.
